224x224.quote: CropNet (MobileNetv3) Model from Tensorflow Hub... As stated in the description the images must be rescaled to 224x224 pixel

384x384.quote: We used the Vision Transformer Architecture with ImageNet weights (ViT-B/16)... Custom top with Linear layer; Image size of (384,384)

512x512.quote: We used a ResNeXt model of the structure "resnext50_32x4d" with the following configurations: image size of (512,512)

brightness.quote: Augmentations (Flip, Transpose, Rotate, Saturation, Contrast and Brightness and some random cropping)

centercrop.quote: Validation Augmentations (Horizontal and vertical flop, CenterCrop, Resize, Normalization)... For inference we used the following augmentations: CenterCrop, Resize, Normalization

coarsedropout.quote: Train Augmentations (RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, Horizontal and vertical flip, ShiftScaleRotate, HueSaturationValue, RandomBrightnessContrast, Normalization, CoarseDropout, Cutout)

contrast.quote: Augmentations (Flip, Transpose, Rotate, Saturation, Contrast and Brightness and some random cropping)

cutout.quote: Train Augmentations (RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, Horizontal and vertical flip, ShiftScaleRotate, HueSaturationValue, RandomBrightnessContrast, Normalization, CoarseDropout, Cutout)

flip.quote: Augmentations (Flip, Transpose, Rotate, Saturation, Contrast and Brightness and some random cropping)... For inference we used simple test time augmentations (Flip, Rotate, Transpose)

horizontalflip.quote: Train augmentations (from the Albumentations Python library): RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, HorizontalFlip. VerticalFlip, ShiftScaleRotate, Normalize

huesaturationvalue.quote: Train Augmentations (RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, Horizontal and vertical flip, ShiftScaleRotate, HueSaturationValue, RandomBrightnessContrast, Normalization, CoarseDropout, Cutout)

random-resized-cropping.quote: Augmentations (Flip, Transpose, Rotate, Saturation, Contrast and Brightness and some random cropping)

randombrightnesscontrast.quote: Train Augmentations (RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, Horizontal and vertical flip, ShiftScaleRotate, HueSaturationValue, RandomBrightnessContrast, Normalization, CoarseDropout, Cutout)

randomcrop.quote: Augmentations (Flip, Transpose, Rotate, Saturation, Contrast and Brightness and some random cropping)

randomresizedcrop.quote: Train augmentations (from the Albumentations Python library): RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, HorizontalFlip. VerticalFlip, ShiftScaleRotate, Normalize

resize.quote: Validation augmentations (from the Albumentations Python library): Resize, Normalize... For inference we used the same augmentations as for validation (i.e., Resize, Normalize)

rotate.quote: Augmentations (Flip, Transpose, Rotate, Saturation, Contrast and Brightness and some random cropping)... For inference we used simple test time augmentations (Flip, Rotate, Transpose)

saturation.quote: Augmentations (Flip, Transpose, Rotate, Saturation, Contrast and Brightness and some random cropping)

shiftscalerotate.quote: Train augmentations (from the Albumentations Python library): RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, HorizontalFlip. VerticalFlip, ShiftScaleRotate, Normalize

transpose.quote: Train augmentations (from the Albumentations Python library): RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, HorizontalFlip. VerticalFlip, ShiftScaleRotate, Normalize... For inference we used simple test time augmentations (Flip, Rotate, Transpose)

tta.quote: For inference we used simple test time augmentations (Flip, Rotate, Transpose)

verticalflip.quote: Train augmentations (from the Albumentations Python library): RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, HorizontalFlip. VerticalFlip, ShiftScaleRotate, Normalize

efficientnet-b4.quote: We tested some of the models separately on the leaderboard (public/private): B4: 89.4%/89.5%

efficientnet-b4-ns.quote: We tried different EfficientNet architectures but finally only used a B4 with NoisyStudent weights

mobilenetv3.quote: Finally, our ensemble included a pretrained CropNet (MobileNetv3) Model from Tensorflow Hub... The CropNet model is based on the MobileNetV3 architecture

resnext50-32x4d.quote: We used a ResNeXt model of the structure "resnext50_32x4d" with the following configurations

vit-b/16.quote: We used the Vision Transformer Architecture with ImageNet weights (ViT-B/16)

cropnet.quote: Finally, our ensemble included a pretrained CropNet (MobileNetv3) Model from Tensorflow Hub: We used a pretrained model from TensorFlow Hub called CropNet which was specifically trained to detect Cassava leaf diseases

imagenet.quote: We used the Vision Transformer Architecture with ImageNet weights (ViT-B/16)

noisystudent.quote: We tried different EfficientNet architectures but finally only used a B4 with NoisyStudent weights

bi-tempered-logistic-loss.quote: Bit Tempered Logistic Loss (t1 = 0.8, t2 = 1.4) and label smoothing factor of 0.06

sigmoid-focal-loss.quote: Sigmoid Focal Loss with Label Smoothing (Gamma=2.0, alpha=0.25 and label smoothing factor 0.1)

adam.source: Top1 solution description - default PyTorch/TensorFlow optimizer
adam.quote: Learning rate of 1e-4 with "ReduceLROnPlateau" scheduler... We chose a learning rate with a Cosine annealing warm restarts scheduler (LR = 1e-4 / 7 [7: Warm up factor]

learning_rate.quote: Learning rate of 1e-4 with "ReduceLROnPlateau" scheduler... We chose a learning rate with a Cosine annealing warm restarts scheduler (LR = 1e-4 / 7 [7: Warm up factor], T0= 10, Tmult= 1, eta_min=1e-4, last_epoch=-1)

cosine-annealing-warm-restarts.quote: We chose a learning rate with a Cosine annealing warm restarts scheduler (LR = 1e-4 / 7 [7: Warm up factor], T0= 10, Tmult= 1, eta_min=1e-4, last_epoch=-1)

reducelronplateau.quote: Learning rate of 1e-4 with "ReduceLROnPlateau" scheduler based on average validation loss (mode='min', factor=0.2, patience=5, eps=1e-6)

warmup-and-cosine-decay.quote: Learning rate with warmup and cosine decay scheduler (ranging from 1e-6 to a maximum of 0.0002 and back to 3.17e-6)

epochs.quote: 5-fold-CV with 15 epochs... 5-fold-CV with 10 epochs... 5-fold-CV with 20 epochs with early stopping... Final model was trained for 14 epochs on whole competition data set

drop-connect.quote: Drop connect rate 0.4, custom top with global average pooling and dropout layer (0.5)

dropout.quote: Drop connect rate 0.4, custom top with global average pooling and dropout layer (0.5)

early-stopping.quote: 5-fold-CV with 20 epochs with early stopping and callback for restoring weights of best epoch

gradient-accumulation.quote: A batch accumulation for backprop with effectively larger batch size

label-smoothing.quote: Bit Tempered Logistic Loss (t1 = 0.8, t2 = 1.4) and label smoothing factor of 0.06... Sigmoid Focal Loss with Label Smoothing (Gamma=2.0, alpha=0.25 and label smoothing factor 0.1)

5-fold.quote: 5-fold-CV with 15 epochs (after the 15 training epochs, we always chose the model with the best validation accuracy) (same data partitioning as for the other trained models)

global-average-pooling.quote: Drop connect rate 0.4, custom top with global average pooling and dropout layer (0.5)

dropout-layer.quote: Drop connect rate 0.4, custom top with global average pooling and dropout layer (0.5)

linear-layer.quote: Custom top with Linear layer; Image size of (384,384)

dropout_rate.quote: Drop connect rate 0.4, custom top with global average pooling and dropout layer (0.5)

stacked-mean.quote: For the ensembling, we experimented with different methods and found that in our case a stacked-mean approach worked best. For this purpose, the class probabilities returned by the models were averaged on several levels and finally the class with the highest probability was returned.

multi-crop.quote: To do so, we cropped 4 overlapping patches of size 512x512px from the .jpg images (800x600px) and applied 2 augmentations to each patch. We retained two additional center-cropped patches of the image to which no augmentations were applied.

tta.quote: For inference we used simple test time augmentations (Flip, Rotate, Transpose). To do so, we cropped 4 overlapping patches of size 512x512px from the .jpg images (800x600px) and applied 2 augmentations to each patch.

pytorch.quote: import timm, import torch, import torch.nn as nn, import torch.nn.functional as F, import torchvision.models as models

tensorflow.quote: import tensorflow as tf... from tensorflow import keras

albumentations.quote: Train augmentations (from the Albumentations Python library): RandomResizedCrop, Transpose, HorizontalFlip. VerticalFlip, ShiftScaleRotate, Normalize

tensorflow-hub.quote: Finally, our ensemble included a pretrained CropNet (MobileNetv3) Model from Tensorflow Hub
